summary: Manages movement, shape transforms, direction detection, and collisions for arrow-like entities. This module exposes both pure utility functions and an OO manager for runtime updates.
ArrowManager.getNormalizedGroupAndBounds(group) Helper function to calculate the bounding box of a group of pixels and normalize their coordinates relative to the top-left of the bounding box.

params.name: table
params.desc: A table of pixel coordinates ({x=x, y=y}).

returns.desc: normalizedGroup A table of pixel coordinates normalized to (0,0) origin.
pixelSet A 2D table for quick lookup of pixel existence in the normalized group.
bounds A table containing minX, minY, maxX, maxY, width, and height of the bounding box.

summary: ArrowManager.checkTaperingShape(normalizedGroup, pixelSet, bounds, isVertical, centerCoord, tipCoord, startCoord, endCoord, stepCoord, getPixelsFunc, getMinMaxFunc, getExpectedSizeFunc) Helper function to check for consistent tapering in arrow shapes (vertical or horizontal).

params.name: table
params.desc: The pixel group with coordinates normalized to (0,0) origin.

params.name: table
params.desc: A 2D table for quick lookup of pixel existence.

params.name: table
params.desc: The bounding box information of the pixel group.

params.name: boolean
params.desc: True if checking a vertical arrow, false for horizontal.

params.name: number
params.desc: The center coordinate (centerX for vertical, centerY for horizontal).

params.name: number
params.desc: The coordinate of the tip (0 or bounds.height-1 for vertical, 0 or bounds.width-1 for horizontal).

params.name: number
params.desc: The starting coordinate for iteration.

params.name: number
params.desc: The ending coordinate for iteration.

params.name: number
params.desc: The step direction for iteration (1 or -1).

params.name: function
params.desc: A function to get pixels along the current row/column.

params.name: function
params.desc: A function to get min/max coordinates from a list of pixels.

params.name: function
params.desc: A function to get the expected size (width/height) for the current row/column.

returns.desc: True if the tapering is consistent, otherwise false.

summary: ArrowManager.isVerticalArrow(normalizedGroup, pixelSet, bounds) Checks if a normalized group of pixels forms a vertical arrow shape. Assumes the arrow has odd width and checks for vertical symmetry and tapering.

params.name: table
params.desc: The pixel group with coordinates normalized to (0,0) origin.

params.name: table
params.desc: A 2D table for quick lookup of pixel existence.

params.name: table
params.desc: The bounding box information of the pixel group.

returns.desc: "up" or "down" if it's a vertical arrow, otherwise nil.

summary: ArrowManager.isHorizontalArrow(normalizedGroup, pixelSet, bounds) Checks if a normalized group of pixels forms a horizontal arrow shape. Assumes the arrow has odd height and checks for horizontal symmetry and tapering.

params.name: table
params.desc: The pixel group with coordinates normalized to (0,0) origin.

params.name: table
params.desc: A 2D table for quick lookup of pixel existence.

params.name: table
params.desc: The bounding box information of the pixel group.

returns.desc: "left" or "right" if it's a horizontal arrow, otherwise nil.

summary: ArrowManager.isDiagonalArrow(normalizedGroup, pixelSet, bounds) Checks if a normalized group of pixels forms a diagonal arrow shape. It checks for specific tip and arm configurations for 4 diagonal directions.

params.name: table
params.desc: The pixel group with coordinates normalized to (0,0) origin.

params.name: table
params.desc: A 2D table for quick lookup of pixel existence.

params.name: table
params.desc: The bounding box information of the pixel group.

returns.desc: "up-right", "up-left", "down-left", or "down-right" if it's a diagonal arrow, otherwise nil.

summary: ArrowManager.isSimpleDiagonalArrow(normalizedGroup, pixelSet, bounds) Checks if a normalized group of pixels forms a simple diagonal line.

params.name: table
params.desc: The pixel group with coordinates normalized to (0,0) origin.

params.name: table
params.desc: A 2D table for quick lookup of pixel existence.

params.name: table
params.desc: The bounding box information of the pixel group.

returns.desc: "up-right", "up-left", "down-left", or "down-right" if it's a diagonal line, otherwise nil.

summary: ArrowManager.getArrowDirection(group) Determines the direction of an arrow shape from a given group of pixels. It first normalizes the group and then checks for vertical, horizontal, and diagonal arrow patterns.

params.name: table
params.desc: A table of pixel coordinates ({x=x, y=y}) representing a potential arrow.

returns.desc: The direction of the arrow (e.g., "up", "down", "left", "right", "up-right", etc.), or nil if not an arrow.

summary: ArrowManager.rotatePixels(pixels, angle, bounds) Rotates a group of pixels around the center of its bounding box.

params.name: table
params.desc: A table of pixel coordinates ({x=x, y=y}).

params.name: number
params.desc: The rotation angle in degrees (e.g., 90, 180, 270).

params.name: table
params.desc: The bounding box information of the pixel group.

returns.desc: A new table of rotated pixel coordinates.

summary: ArrowManager.mirrorPixels(pixels, axis, bounds) Mirrors a group of pixels horizontally or vertically.

params.name: table
params.desc: A table of pixel coordinates ({x=x, y=y}).

params.name: string
params.desc: "horizontal" or "vertical".

params.name: table
params.desc: The bounding box information of the pixel group.

returns.desc: A new table of mirrored pixel coordinates.

summary: ArrowManager.rotatePixelsArbitrary(pixels, angle, bounds) Rotates a group of pixels around the center of its bounding box by an arbitrary angle.

params.name: table
params.desc: A table of pixel coordinates ({x=x, y=y}).

params.name: number
params.desc: The rotation angle in degrees.

params.name: table
params.desc: The bounding box information of the pixel group.

returns.desc: A new table of rotated pixel coordinates.

summary: ArrowManager.getTransformedShape(baseShape, baseBounds, fromDirection, toDirection) Transforms a pixel shape from one direction to another.

params.name: table
params.desc: The initial pixel shape (normalized).

params.name: table
params.desc: The bounding box of the base shape.

params.name: string
params.desc: The direction the base shape is currently oriented in.

params.name: string
params.desc: The desired final direction.

returns.desc: The transformed pixel shape.
The bounds of the transformed shape.

summary: ArrowManager.new(level, arrowSpeed) Creates a new ArrowManager object.

params.name: Level
params.desc: The current active level object.

params.name: number
params.desc: The base speed of the arrows in pixels per second.

returns.desc: A new ArrowManager instance.

summary: ArrowManager:update(dt) Updates the movement of all entities marked as 'isMoving' (arrows). Handles collision detection for moving entities and reverses their direction upon hitting static objects.

params.name: number
params.desc: The time elapsed since the last frame in seconds.

summary: Handles collision detection/resolution between moving entities and the level grid/entities. Provides utility routines for broad/narrow phase checks used by ArrowManager and Game.
CollisionManager.new(level, gameWidth, gameHeight) Creates a new CollisionManager object.

params.name: Level
params.desc: The current active level

params.name: number
params.desc: The width of the game world in grid units.

params.name: number
params.desc: The height of the game world in grid units.

returns.desc: A new CollisionManager instance.

summary: CollisionManager:getCollisionPixels(entity, moveDx, moveDy, collisionMode) Determines the specific pixels to check for collision based on the specified collision mode.

params.name: Entity
params.desc: The moving entity (arrow).

params.name: number
params.desc: The intended movement in X direction.

params.name: number
params.desc: The intended movement in Y direction.

params.name: string
params.desc: The collision mode to use ("pixel_perfect" or "aabb").

returns.desc: A list of pixel data for collision checking.

summary: CollisionManager:checkPlayerMovement(playerEntity, dx, dy) Checks if a player entity can move and handles collisions.

params.name: Entity
params.desc: The player-controlled entity.

params.name: number
params.desc: The intended movement in the x-direction.

params.name: number
params.desc: The intended movement in the y-direction.

returns.desc: True if the player can move, false otherwise.
True if the player has won, false otherwise.
True if the player has lost, false otherwise.

summary: CollisionManager:resolveEntityCollision(collidedEntity, level) Resolves the collision by removing the collided entity from the level.

params.name: Entity
params.desc: The entity that was collided with.

params.name: Level
params.desc: The current active level.

summary: Defines global constants for the game, including consolidated color definitions.
COLORS Defines the RGBA color values used to identify different entity types in level images. All colors include an alpha component (a=1) for consistency.
Defines the structure and behavior of game entities, such as players, enemies, walls, and collectibles. `floatX`, and `floatY` (precise floating-point coordinates).
Entity.new(type, pixels, color) Creates a new Entity object. Initializes the entity's type, color, and sets up its pixels with both integer and floating-point positions.

params.name: string
params.desc: The type of the entity.

params.name: table
params.desc: A table of initial pixel coordinates ({x=x, y=y}).

params.name: table
params.desc: The RGB color of the entity.

params.name: table
params.desc: The normalized pixel group representing the entity's shape (relative to 0,0).

params.name: table
params.desc: The bounding box of the original pixel group.

returns.desc: A new Entity instance.

summary: Entity:setMoving(direction) Sets the entity's movement state and direction.

params.name: string
params.desc: The movement direction (e.g., "up", "down", "left", "right").

summary: Entity:updateCollisionMapPosition(level, newPixelsData) Updates the entity's position in the collision map and its internal pixel coordinates.

params.name: Level
params.desc: The current active level.

params.name: table
params.desc: A table of new pixel data, each with newFloatX, newFloatY, nextGridX, nextGridY, and original pixel reference.

summary: Entity:removeFromCollisionMap(level) Removes the entity's current pixel positions from the collision map.

params.name: Level
params.desc: The current active level.

summary: Entity:updateVisualShape() Updates the entity's `pixels` table based on its `normalizedShape` and `direction`. This method applies transformations (mirroring/rotation) to the base shape and keeps the shape centered.
Entity:draw() Draws the entity on the screen using its current floating-point pixel positions, rounded to the nearest integer for rendering on the grid.
Central game object: initialization, update loop, drawing, and input handling.
Game.new() Creates a new Game object and initializes game settings.

returns.desc: A new Game instance.

summary: The current active level of the game.
Manages collision detection and resolution.
Game:reset() Resets the game to its initial playing state, reloading the level.
Game:update(dt) Called every frame to update game logic. Handles player movement, collision detection, entity updates, and win/loss conditions.

params.name: number
params.desc: The time elapsed since the last frame in seconds.

summary: Game:draw() Called every frame to draw game elements. Scales the graphics and draws the current level.
Game:keypressed(key) Handles keyboard key press events.

params.name: string
params.desc: The name of the key pressed.

summary: Defines the game over screen scene.
GameOver.new(sceneManager, gameInstance) Creates a new GameOver scene instance.

params.name: table
params.desc: The SceneManager instance.

params.name: table
params.desc: The Game instance.

returns.desc: A new GameOver scene instance.

summary: GameOver:load() Called when the game over scene is set as active.
GameOver:update(dt) Updates the game over scene logic. (No specific logic for game over screen)

params.name: number
params.desc: The time elapsed since the last frame.

summary: GameOver:draw() Draws the game over screen elements.
GameOver:keypressed(key) Handles key press events for the game over scene.

params.name: string
params.desc: The name of the key pressed.

summary: Manages the game levels: load from image, create entities, collisions, and updates.
Level.new(imagePath) Creates a new Level object and loads its data from the specified image.

params.name: string
params.desc: The path to the image file representing the level layout.

returns.desc: A new Level instance.

summary: Level:load() It uses a flood-fill algorithm to group adjacent pixels of the same color into entities.
Level:draw() Draws all entities in the current level.
Level:addEntity(newEntity) Adds a new entity to the level and distributes it to appropriate lists.

params.name: Entity
params.desc: The entity to add.

summary: Entry point for the LÃ–VE2D game. Initializes and runs the main Game class.
Manages different game scenes (e.g., Game, Win, GameOver).
SceneManager.new() Creates a new SceneManager instance.

returns.desc: A new SceneManager instance.

summary: SceneManager:set_scene(scene) Sets the current active scene and calls its load method.

params.name: table
params.desc: The scene object to set as active.

summary: SceneManager:update(dt) Updates the current active scene.

params.name: number
params.desc: The time elapsed since the last frame.

summary: SceneManager:draw() Draws the current active scene.
SceneManager:keypressed(key) Handles key press events for the current active scene.

params.name: string
params.desc: The name of the key pressed.

summary: SceneManager:reset_game() Resets the game instance and sets the scene back to the game.
Provides utility functions for the game, including flood-fill for grouping pixels and functions for detecting arrow shapes and their directions.

Utils.floodFill(levelData, startX, startY, color, visited) Groups adjacent pixels of the same color using a flood-fill algorithm. This is used during level loading to identify and create entities from pixel art.

params.name: ImageData
params.desc: The image data of the level.

params.name: number
params.desc: The starting X coordinate for the flood fill.

params.name: number
params.desc: The starting Y coordinate for the flood fill.

params.name: table
params.desc: The RGB color to match for grouping pixels.

params.name: table
params.desc: A table used to keep track of visited pixels to prevent infinite loops.

returns.desc: A table containing all grouped pixel coordinates ({x=x, y=y}).

summary: Utils.getAABB(entity, offsetX, offsetY) Calculates the Axis-Aligned Bounding Box (AABB) for a given entity.

params.name: Entity
params.desc: The entity to calculate the AABB for.

params.name: number
params.desc: An offset to apply to the X coordinates.

params.name: number
params.desc: An offset to apply to the Y coordinates.

returns.desc: minX The minimum X coordinate of the AABB.
minY The minimum Y coordinate of the AABB.
maxX The maximum X coordinate of the AABB.
maxY The maximum Y coordinate of the AABB.

summary: Utils.getAABBRounded(entity, offsetX, offsetY) Calculates the Axis-Aligned Bounding Box (AABB) for a given entity, with coordinates rounded to the nearest integer for grid-based collision.

params.name: Entity
params.desc: The entity to calculate the AABB for.

params.name: number
params.desc: An offset to apply to the X coordinates.

params.name: number
params.desc: An offset to apply to the Y coordinates.

returns.desc: minX The minimum X coordinate of the rounded AABB.
minY The minimum Y coordinate of the rounded AABB.
maxX The maximum X coordinate of the rounded AABB.
maxY The maximum Y coordinate of the rounded AABB.

summary: Utils.log(message) Conditionally prints a message to the console if DEBUG_MODE is enabled.

params.name: string
params.desc: The message to print.

summary: Defines the win screen scene.
Win.new(sceneManager, gameInstance) Creates a new Win scene instance.

params.name: table
params.desc: The SceneManager instance.

params.name: table
params.desc: The Game instance.

returns.desc: A new Win scene instance.

summary: Win:load() Called when the win scene is set as active.
Win:update(dt) Updates the win scene logic. (No specific logic for win screen)

params.name: number
params.desc: The time elapsed since the last frame.

summary: Win:draw() Draws the win screen elements.
Win:keypressed(key) Handles key press events for the win scene.

params.name: string
params.desc: The name of the key pressed.
